sen.j: 阿部 正由（あべ まさよし）は、江戸時代の大名。
sen.e: Masayoshi ABE was a daimyo (feudal lord) during the Edo period.
Masayoshi ABE was a daimyo (feudal lord) during the Edo period.
Masayoshi ABE was a daimyo (feudal lord) during the Edo period.

sen.j: 第8代武蔵国忍藩主。
sen.e: He was the 8th generation lord of the Oshi domain in Musashino Province.
He was the 8th generation lord of the Oshi domain in Musashino Province.
He was the 8th generation lord of the Oshi domain in Musashino Province.

sen.j: 寺社奉行、大坂城代、京都所司代。
sen.e: He held roles such as: Supervisor of Temples & Shrines, Chamberlain of Osaka Castle and Controller of Kyoto samurai.
He held roles such as: Supervisor of Temples & Shrines, Chamberlain of Osaka Castle and Controller of Kyoto samurai.
He held roles such as: jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle) and Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy).
sen.cmt: 全角→半角用語集に統一

sen.j: 忠秋系阿部家8代。
sen.e: Masayoshi ABE was 8th generation of the Tadaaki branch of the Abe family.
Masayoshi ABE was 8th generation of the Tadaaki branch of the Abe family.
Masayoshi ABE was 8th generation of the Abe family with ties to Tadaaki.

sen.j: 初名は松平頼朴。
sen.e: Initially he went by the name of `Yorinao MATSUDAIRA`.
Initially he went by the name of `Yorinao MATSUDAIRA`.
Initially he went by the name of 'Yorinao MATSUDAIRA.'

sen.j: 宝暦12年（1762年）11月22日、紀州藩主・徳川宗将の十一男として生まれる。
sen.e: Masayoshi ABE was born Nov 22, 1762 as 11th son of the Kishu domain lord Munenobu TOKUGAWA.
Masayoshi ABE was born Nov 22, 1762 as 11th son of the Kishu domain lord Munenobu TOKUGAWA.
Masayoshi ABE was born January 5, 1763 as 11th son of the Kishu domain lord Munenobu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 幼名は久米之丞。
sen.e: As a child he was known as Kumenojo (久米之丞).
As a child he was known as Kumenojo (久米之丞).
As a child he was known as Kumenojo (久米之丞).

sen.j: 寛政5年（1793年）阿部正識の養子となり、寛政8年（1796年）に家督を相続。
sen.e: In １７９３ he became the adopted son of Masatsune ABE and in 1796 inherited the role of head of the family.
In １７９３ he became the adopted son of Masatsune ABE and in 1796 inherited the role of head of the family.
In 1793, he became the adopted son of Masatsune ABE and in 1796 inherited the role of head of the family.

sen.j: 寛政10年（1798年）奏者番、享和元年（1801年）寺社奉行、文化 (元号)元年（1804年）大坂城代、文化3年（1806年）京都所司代を歴任した。
sen.e: In 1798 he took on the role of Attendant (奏者番) at the shogunate, followed in succession by roles as: Supervisor of Temples & Shrines (寺社奉行) in 1804, Osaka Castle Chamberlain (1806) and Controller of Kyoto samurai (1806).

In 1798 he took on the role of Attendant (奏者番) at the shogunate, followed in succession by roles as: Supervisor of Temples & Shrines (寺社奉行) in 1804, Osaka Castle Chamberlain (1806) and Controller of Kyoto samurai (1806).
In 1798 he took on sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) at the shogunate, followed in succession by roles as: jisha-bugyo in 1804, Osaka jodai (1806) and Kyoto shoshidai (1806).
Ho passed away on October 11, 1808.

Ho passed away on October 11, 1808.

sen.j: 長男・阿部正権が家督を継いだ。
sen.e: His eldest son (Masanori ABE) took over as heads of the family.
His eldest son (Masanori ABE) took over as heads of the family.
His eldest son (Masanori ABE) took over as heads of the family.

sen.j: 享年47（満45歳没）。
sen.e: He passed away at 45 years of age.
He passed away at 45 years of age.
He passed away at 45 years of age.
